glsa.title: Chromium, V8: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in Chromium and V8, some of which may allow execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Chromium is an open source web browser project. V8 is Google's open source JavaScript engine. SPDY is an experimental networking protocol.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Chromium and V8. Please review the CVE identifiers and release notes referenced below for details.

impact.p: A context-dependent attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted web site or JavaScript program using Chromium or V8, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, or a Denial of Service condition.
The attacker could also entice a user to open a specially crafted web site using Chromium, possibly resulting in cross-site scripting (XSS), or an unspecified SPDY certificate checking error.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
